      ClientGUI gui)
       throws java.io.IOException
        The constructor that creates a new Client. It gets a name, a portnumber, a host and a ClientGUI After it is created, it sends an hello message to the server.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        When the clienthread is started and the Client is connected, it will process the incoming messages.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        When this method is called, the message that is given as an parameter will be printed to the Client. After that, the message will be written to the output stream of the socket. If that is not possible, the Client will terminate.
        Parameters:
        msg -

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        The method that will shutdown the client. It will shutdown the socket input and output and then close the socket. After that it will dispose the ClientGUI and then exit the program.

        public java.lang.String getClientName()
        Returns the name of the client.
